title: Haveli  - Large room in Art & Book filled mansion!
about: Haveli Hauz Khas - a Boutique B&B oasis in Delhi - heritage mansion in centrally located, tree-lined, safe & quiet Hauz Khas Enclave, with traditionally done large, spacious rooms. Haveli is designed with Indian heritage as the main theme - with photographs, lithographs, canvases, carved wood, traditional textiles and hand-woven durries. Guests are free to peruse and browse my extensive book collection, including of books written by me.Haveli is close to both - Hauz Khas village & the MetroThe spaceOur Ajanta room is a large, spacious deluxe room in the Haveli Hauz Khas - an independent house with many outdoor sitting areas. The decor is traditional and theme-based on the famous Ajanta caves in Maharashtra, which were made in the 2nd century BC.What’s included:- Breakfast - from 8am to 10am - your choice of Continental (eggs to order) or Indian (special Aloo parathas), with Fresh seasonal fruits, Juice, Milk and Cereal, home made Jams and Marmalades, your choice of a variety of Indian Teas or freshly brewed Coffee,- Comfortable beds, - FlatLED TV, - Electronic Safety Lockers in all Rooms,- Tea & Coffee,- Air-conditioning,- En-suite Bathrooms, with hot and cold running water,- Mineral water,- High-speed Wi-Fi Internet throughout the house,- Study table and chairs,- Computer with printer and copying facility available,- Trained, experienced staff. Security Guard 24x7,- Safe Taxis can be arranged,- Quiet Residential area, very safe for women travelers and families,- Large beautiful park behind Haveli, more within walking distance,- Bustling Hauz Khas village is three blocks away, with the best Restaurants and Cafe's in South Delhi,- Banks and ATM's are nearby.We, your hosts, live in the house itself, in a cozy room next to the kitchen.Location: On the First floor

reviews.reivew: This was my second time at Haveli Hauz Khaz and had a great time again!

I absolutely loved my stay at Haveli Hauz Khaz! As a solo women traveller I really appreciated all the time and care the hosts offered me to answer all my questions,  ask me aboutmy day and just provide a warm and welcoming presence for me. I also really loved the decor and spaciousness of my room and the rooftop patio. I woke up for sunrise everyday I was there and it was so peaceful and serene to sit on the patio and meditate. The location is in a very safe part of Delhi and there is lots to do around there. I would come back for sure next time in am in New Delhi!
I highly recommend this Delhi gem! Charming and comfortable, homey and professional. Lovely touches, great atmosphere. Nice food!! I can’t wait to stay again...

I had a very pleasant stay at Haveli Hauz Khas. My room was large, clean, and spacious as promised and the accommodation was very comfortable overall. Neelu and her staff were very accommodating, helping me settle in and even preparing a special round of breakfast for me during the morning of my stay. Overall a positive experience.
Neighborhood was lovely, staff helpful.

title: The Living Woods- Red Royal Wooden Bide
about: The Living Woods- Red Royal Wooden Bide.This is a retreat in the middle of an apple orchard, 25 km beyond Shimla. Our cottage and Villa are newly builtretreat in Cheog, Himachal.It's a perfect blend of village life, apple trees, the whistling pines. The only sound one could hear is of the chirping of birds, an occasional vehicle and some one and a half dogs.Summers are pleasant though winters are cold. It can snow anytime from Mid December- March. Snowfall can be mild to heavy.The spaceRed Royal Wooden Bide.It's a brand new property having 3 single room cottages with attached toilets , a separate  dining hall  ( pretty spacious) with kitchen attached.Fresh and hot,home made, food is served, on advance intimation.Breakfast will be served between 8.30 am to 10am. ( Rs 250/- per person )Lunch will be served between 1 pm to 2.30 pm ( Veg 350/- )Non Veg chicken 450/- per person)Rs 600/- for non veg Mutton dish .Dinner will be served between 9 pm to 10.30 pm ( Veg 350/- )Non Veg ( chicken dish 450/- per person) Rs 600/- per person for non veg Mutton dish.Food / snacks are served  in the dining hall only.The cottages and our home is  right in the middle of an apple orchard. If you happen to be at our place during the apple season, you will see trees laden with apples all over the property.You will witness the entire orchard blooming with  blossoms in the first week of April. The sight is not only pleasing to the eye but also symbolises  new beginning and announces the commencement of Spring. The brief beauty of petals is really a sight to see. It carries a very subtle, soft ,sweet and floral scent. The light breeze helps odour molecules travel !To add to this, one can see  the bumble bees and hear their buzzing sound. Not to miss out on the honey bees and their humming sounds and differently coloured, butterflies ! All these help in pollination !!!Apples normally mature within 130- 150 days  after the full bloom stage, depending on the variety grown. One can see the apples grow in various sizes anytime from  Mid April till the harvesting season  which begins from Mid August and lasts till aboutthe last week of September. You could witness the plucking of apples, grading and packing them in the boxes. We have two machans where one can  sit and bask in the sun. Sip in a  beer or two. Have a soft drink or a juice.Parking is available inside the property.Our apple orchard is surrounded by dense deodar forest with no immediate neighbors. The best part of staying here is that it re - connects with nature. You are away from the distractions of daily life, yet close enough to the main town of Shimla to not feel too disconnected. It is best suited for people who prefer serenity, isolation, privacy, nature and tranquility. Locals here engage in intensive apple and vegetable farming. Respecting local sentiments will be highly appreciated. Though the place has no immediate neighbors, sound does travel fast and clear in a place where one can hear chirping of birds and whistling of the pines quite distinctly. Thus, loud music or loud noises, which may disturb the locals, will not be appreciated, specially in the night.The village market is just about500 meters away and has good 25 odd shops, SBI bank, ATM, couple of Chemists and a doctor's clinic. There is also a government ayurvedic hospital and a Higher Secondary School. If you are a keen walker and love nature walks, you can go for treks ( short or long ) around the property or just stroll around to enjoy the flora and the scenic beauty.We have board games like, ludo, chess, tambola, scrabble, carrom for your enjoyment.One can enjoy bonfire facility, at an additional cost, under the clear sky.Barbeque facility is available at the property, at an additional cost. . (Rs 650/- per kg and 350/- for half kg both Chicken and Paneer).Shimla generally has serious water crisis during the summer season. We, fortunately have  perennial water supply from a water spring, with good storage capacity.At an altitude of 7000 feet, you do not require fans even in peak summer time. The place is pretty cold in the winters and you could see snow fall anytime from December to end  February or even early March.Snowfall could be mild to heavy. We have wooden cottages  with glasswool insulated roofs and semi carpeted  floors to keep the rooms warm. We request our guests not to wear outdoor shoes inside the room. Slippers are provided to be used indoors only.During the winters we provide electric blankets, room heaters and if need be,  hot water bottles to keep our guests warm. However, we strictly advise you to carry warm clothes during the winter time.All three cottages have solar water heaters  to provide hot water in the bathrooms. On cloudy days you could switch the electric geyser, installed in the bathrooms. Alternately, we provide hot water in buckets for you to have your bath, just in case there is a power failure due to inclement weather. As of now we do not have a power back up facility.Our retreat is a perfect getaway and if you are looking for rejuvenation and a surreal experience with luxury, this should be your holiday destination. The place  is suitable for bird watching/ photography and an ideal place for writers, poets, painters, musicians, foreigners, people into meditation, yoga etc. People who intend staying in a peaceful and a pollution free place for longer durations are offered special discounts The clear night skies can be a delight for star gazing. The Cottages : We have one Villa with two independent rooms and one separate Cottage. Our rooms- “Rich- Red Wooden Bide” can accommodate two guests with one additional mattress. “Red- Royal Wooden Bide” can also accommodate two guests, with one  additional mattresses.“Royal Wooden Cottage” is perfect for a family of four. Smoking and drinking in the rooms is strictly prohibited. Guests can smoke or drink outside, in the open areas.All the rooms have a balcony attached. One can bask in the sun here throughout the day, specially in the summers. However, in winters, the sun is available for a shorter duration ( 9am to 2.30 pm) at the property. We have pets ( 2 dogs) in our house who stay in a separate place.  However, we do not allow guests to bring their pets. You will encounter a pretty wide kachha road  of  500 metres  leading to my home. The entire apple orchard has a solar electric fence and CCTV cameras installed. Both are  operational round the clock.Last, but not the least,  to the best of our abilities , we assure you of a comfortable and a homely stay with complete privacy. We believe, you go back home with lots of good memories, cherish them , share them with your near and dear ones  and remember us, in your prayers !Guest accessThe guests have an access to the entire property. Needless to say, apple plucking or any damage to the apple trees must be avoided.Other things to noteThe property is secure and is under CCTV surveillancePets are not allowed.Doctor is available on callState Bank of India and an ATM is available at a walking distanceLaundry services are provided on request (Chargeable)Taxi service is available on request (Chargeable)Accommodation ( subject to availability) and food is available for drivers,  at an extra charge. We provide same food as served to our guests . However, we suggest they eat outside in the market.We expect our guests to keep the property clean and tidy ( at all times during their stay and at the time of check out.

reviews.reivew: It was a memorable experience  staying with Manoj .  A very humble and down to earth couple who  go out of the way to make your stay memorable.

Manoj uncle and Vandana aunty were amazing hosts! The hospitality and food (they served us amazing south Indian food for breakfast) was really amazing. The variety of food was also impressive. The only comprehension is the priceof the property, a bit pricey along with the adjacent expenses (To and fro travel to the property). Rest, would be happy to pay a revisit with a tad lower price:)

Manoj ji and Vandana ji are the best host one can ask for. They own this amazing farm at a fanatastic location. Wonderful hospitality, great people. I am certainly going to be back to stay this lovely couple.

Tucked away 1 hour 45mins away from the busy Shimla is this gorgeous apply orchard hosted by the Chadha family!It’s a gorgeous property with several apple trees interspersed with beautiful flowering plants curated by Mrs. Chadha, an avid gardener.The rooms are spacious and tastefully curated with woodwork and ethnic furnishing, a treat to the eyes.The room and bathroom are stocked up with all the amenitiesyou can think of, almost a hotel-like experience.The Chadha family left no stone unturned. If you thought of something you needed, it was found in the room 😀Mealtimes were the best! They cook yummy punjabi food and customised it to our liking. Tip - don’t miss the yummy butter chicken and ghee shakkar dessert. The dining area was designed so thoughtfully, with beautiful crockery and a great sit-down experience. The Chadha family are not only great hosts but also great company. We had some of the most interesting conversations over our meals with them. If you think of unwinding and having a peaceful experience, this is the place. From the garden swing in the morning, to snoozing on the hammock at noon, to the machan for chai/a drink, it’s everything you can dream of!The hiking trails around the property are great to explore in the morning with fresh air to breathe and greenery galore.If you’re planning a trip to Himachal, this is a must-do.

I stayed at this place with my friends and all of us feltthat it was our best outing ever. The host Mr. Manoj is very hospitable and takes care of everything with his personal touch. We will soon be visting him again.

This was such an amazing experience for all of us. The hosts -  Manoj and his wife are such nice people and will assist you with everything you want. The resort is one of the best places to stay around Kufri, covered with Apple orchids. It has spots for photography as well. Hammocks, barbeque, small spots to sit and chill with your friends, Manoj has taken care of everything. The rooms had a unique style and I loved it.  Food was top-notch. I loved the mutton that they cook. Plus there is a snack that Manoj surprised us with that made our stay even more memorable. I am definitely going to visit again. 5 stars

title: Travellers House, Leh
about: Travellers House, Leh is a cozy, 8 double rooms(twin bedded) guest house located at Karzu, Leh. Simply the best and and at perfect location in Leh (you won't ask for more!). reviews.reivew: Our time at Travellers House was excellent! Sami and her family are friendly, flexible, and warm.  Communication was very good at all times. The place was very clean and breakfast was delicious.  I would be happy coming back and strongly recommend Sami’s Travellers House.

The only observation is that the large open windows are the only source of ventilation & seem a bit insecure during the night. Otherwise highly recommended.

Everything fine! Very nice hosts with perfect networking.  Organisation of trip round Ladakh. Rooms with beautiful garden in front of. Breakfast very well. Very nice people carying for the guests. Guesthouse is situated about5 min by feet to the center of Leh.  We will come back for sure!

Clean, functional, quiet place with a lovely garden and helpful host.

title: Valley Retreat, Chowari (Full First Floor)
about: Valley Retreat is a family managed home stay, situated at Chowari, district Chamba. It's ideally located midway between Chamba, Dalhousie and Dharamsala.Home stay offers the entire 1st floor with 2 bedrooms, a modern washroom and vast sit-outsThe spaceValley Retreat is a family managed home stay, situated at Chowari, a Block HQ with a population of 3000 in district Chamba, Himachal Pradesh.Chowari is an ideal base to explore places in the districts of Chamba and Kangra. It's ideally located midway between Chamba and Dharamsala. It is at a 2 hours drive (85 Kms) from Dharamsala airport and 2 hours (55 kms) from Chamba. Dalhousie and Khajjiar can be reached in an hour (40 - 55 Kms).The family home has two floors. Home stay offers the entire 1st floor with two bedrooms, a modern washroom and two vast sit-outs with beautiful views of the fields and the mountains around. The hosts – Anshuman and Punam stay on the ground floor, hence available for any help round the clock.Television is available in the living room of the ground floor. We have deliberately not put televisions in the guest bedroomsso as to encourage our guests to enjoy the physical surroundings and be away from the gadgets. Mobile phone voice connectivity and Airtel / Vodafone data connectivity is usually good.

reviews.reivew: This property was chosen by us as it was not in a bustling tourist place but rather away from crowded places. The property has two rooms whicha quite spacious and can easily house 10-15ppl. Chowari is small town. Access to the property is slightly difficultas the bylanes are quite narrow and local drivers can navigate pretty well here. Breakfast is part of the package cooked by Mr. Anshuman's family. Meals are provided on chargeable basis. However they cook wonderful homemade food. The hospitality and guidance provided by Mr. Anshuman is unforgettable. The property is surrounded by hills which makes it quite beautiful. You get basic amenitieshere.Overall a very satisfying stay..
Go for it without any doubt!

The place looks exactly like shown in pictures. Mridul's brother (Anshuman) is a very good host. He went above and beyond to help us feel comfortable. This place is easily accessible from Dalhousie and Khajjiar, would definitely recommend.
Must go place

We couldn't have asked for a much better stay in such peak season of travel. The location is peaceful, green and beautiful view of the mountains. The house though is a little inside the town, but we didn't face any challenge as Anshuman picked and dropped us to back and forth from staying place to the main market. The rooms and washrooms were sparkling clean which we loved as it's rare to find clean places these days. The bedwere comfortable and we had access to two open huge balconies for morning teas and evening night conversations and walk. Food is a way to human's heart - they touched our hearts with the food they served. We had all our breakfast and dinner at the stay. One night they served the local food and it was finger licking good. We were two families, with two kids and we all enjoyed and feltrelaxed during our stay. Families who enjoy open spaces and terraces, this place is perfect. Folks who like local cuisine and home food, this is the place to stay. People who want to avoid traffic and have some alone time or spend time with families chit chatting and playing this is place to be.Thank you Mridul and Anshuman for make our vacation a warm and rejuvenating one.

Most of us have drawn a small village, mountains, sun, trees, birds in childhood drawing. This place, Chowari, is like that, a beautiful village surrounded by mountains, small houses, cool breeze coming from mountains, chirping birds, terrace farms,  pine trees, good people and a beautiful home stay. To reach Anshuman's house you have to cross Chowari's small bazaar, this is normal small town crowded market, just hold your thought till you reach this homestay. Views are spectacular from house, you have access to big terrace from where you can enjoy mountain breeze. This place is super clean and has all the amenitiesyou need. Your host Anshuman Ji is very warm person and always available for anything you need. This is a perfect location to stay from hustle bustle of city life. There are some good treks that you can plan. We could only go to Chamunda Mata temple trek, which is near the village and on top of mountain. This place could be you base for Dalhousie, Khajjiar and other treks.Anshuman Ji and his family are perfect host. My son enjoyed Sachit's  (Anshuman's son) company a lot. Just knowing that my son's birthday is during our stay he planned a surprised birthday celebration. If I don't mention aboutthe food then this reviewwill not be complete. They have prepared delicious food for us. Taste and aroma were unmatched for all the dishes. I can confidently say this is my best homestay so far and Anshuman Ji is best host. I only have option to give 5 start, for me this is a 10 star homestay.

title: Stay with a Chef Culinary Homestay, Economy Room
about: Walking distance from Popular places in Indore, namely Brilliant Convention Centre, Apollo Hospital, Malls like C21, Malhar, Hotels like Sayaji, Radisson, Marriotts, Cinema halls like INOX, Carnival, PVR, etc and all the major shopping and business areas are close by to our home.The spaceThe rooms are well furnished with Mitsubishi AC, Tata Sky with all HD Channels, Bathroom with Jaguar and Plumber fittings and a decent library of books for you to browse through.

reviews.reivew: Amit is an excellent host and so are his wife and his six year old cute daughter, Pihu.  He was always ready to help/guide and was open to share his culinary skills with us,too. We had a wonderful stay.

The room is clean and convenient even if small. The host, being a Chef, provides delicious complimentary breakfast. He also gave us tips on where to eat what. His family made us feel like we were visiting our own people. They also do cooking workshops and food tours. I opted for a workshop and thoroughly enjoyed it. Go for it!

We stayed here for a night in end of Feb. Right from greeting us to seeing us off, Amit was a perfect host, a travellers delight. Being on an impromptu roadtrip, we could only stay in Indore for a night. Now we wished we stayed more. Amit's tips helped us make the most of the time we had in Indore. His home is clean and spacious. It is in a very good location. His family is warm and welcoming. The room has all the little touches a traveller appreciates. The whole living space was very clean and well maintained. There is a seperate kitchen that is provided for guests to use. He left a box of muffins and some snacks in the room for us in case we got hungry.. we do appreciated the touch, not to mention that the muffins (home baked) were awesome. We opted for an Indori breakfast and were not disappointed! Amit is trained chef with years of experience and hence loads of knowledge and stories! If food is your thing, you will definitely not be disappointed with the conversations had there. We loved staying there and would definitely be back. We recommend anyone to book his place without a second thought.

My husband and I decided to stay at Amit's place for 2 nights after seeing the glowing reviews!  And we were so glad to do so!  Communication :  As soon as we booked, Amit immediately got in communication with us providing us details of the accommodation, address, directions etc.  Upon request he even helped us with suggestions (like a family member would do)on how we can get to Ujjain from the Indore airport.  This was even before we reached him.  After we reached his place on day 2 of our trip, he was in constant communication whether it was suggestions on the best places to visit for sightseeing, shopping or food  OR organising transport for our daytrip to Maheshwar etc !!Rooms and amenities:  Amit's home is in a nice quiet locality.  Very clean rooms and smelling really good!  Room decor, linen was good.  amenitiessuch as complementary coffee, tea, basic toast etc, in addition to use of a Fridge if required.  There are multiple books on Amit's interest 'FOOD'!!Food :  We were welcomed with very good tea!.  Our stay was short and most of which was outside Amit's place and therefore we did not get a chance to check out Amit's full range of culinary skills!!  However we had the best Poha and Kachori's for breakfast!!  The welcome goodies such as Namkeens and cupcakes were really good as well!  Hospitality :  5 Stars for the hospitality!  It was better than staying with our own family!  Value for money :  Cost of the property is a steal for the above amenitiesand most importantly the hospitality!  GO FOR IT!!
Amazing place.

Amit, is a great host. He helped us to plan our trip-recommended famous things to be tried and tested. Living at his house never made me feel as I am away from my home :). Property is well-maintained, open space, living room, kitchen to share....everything was at its place... friends, while you're in Indore-do visit this place and meet the wonderful host, get treated with home-made muffins, brownies....you're lucky to get tasted Amit's pastries :)

title: Cozy Hidden Himalayan home w/pvt kitchen &terrace
about: A place where the world ceases to exist in the midst of nature. An ode to slow living for the hustlers in the city.The idea of a homestay was born out of a searing need to create a home that pushes us to seek from the ancient forest surrounding our estate , to sing along with the birdsong and to sleep looking at the stars.The space*PRIVATE 100 mbps WIFI*PRIVATE SPACE WITH 2 BEDROOM, KITCHEN AND WASHROOM ATTACHED*Day hikes, treks,waterfall and cafes just around the corner

reviews.reivew: It was a great experience staying at gharsa homestay. Place is neat and tidy with a very good location. Moxa was really helpful for all our queries and needs. There are lovely fur friends to keep you company.

We had a wonderful stay at Moxa's place; it truly exceeded our expectations. The property, done in a log cabin style, is wonderful - warm, cozy, gorgeously decorated, with a fully stocked kitchen, comfortable sleeping spaces (especially loved the attic bedroom!), a guitar, plenty of board games and books. The hosts - Moxa, Anshu, Achintya and the resident doggo Olive - are very warm and welcoming. We loved getting to know them. They went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable - a) they served us delicious and generous portions of meals and snacks (they have an elaborate menu and all items are prepared with care), b) they suggested plenty of things we could do in and around the area, such as short trips and food suggestions, which were very useful, c) they recommended great nearby hikes and took us on a particularly beautiful one too - definitely a trip highlight. Overall, we cannot recommend Ghar Sa homestay enough. We are definitely coming back here again!

It’s a excellent place to stay and It was the best experience staying there with such a wonderful hosts. Location is very beautiful and very well maintained. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. We loved the ambience & closeness to nature.!! would definitely and highly recommend this place & I would definitely want to come back to this place again.

I had a wonderful stay at Moxa’s place. Its located in a very calm and tranquil location, away from the crowded places. Very easily accessible by road. Both, Achintya and Moxa are amazing hosts and pay a personal attention to everything. I will surely visit them again and highly recommend anyone looking for a quaint place

This is an amazing property away from the rush of the City's.  This property is surrounded by greenery and as the  namesuggests 'Gharsa' this property is a home away from home. The hosts are amazing and the food they serve is delicious. The hosts also love to travel hence you get really good company if you want to explore. I would recommend everyone to book this property if you want an amazing experience.

It is a perfect place to stay around Manali. Being 100m away from the main road, which gives you privacy and also surrounded by apple orchards. You can enjoy the view of Rohtang and Brighu. We enjoyed the conversations and home made healthy food with a yummy cake. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends and would come back soon.!!!!

title: NASHEMAN  nComfortable 2 bedroomswith Breakfast
about: This trendy spot offers lots of charming details.Peaceful environment and cozy bedroom in my family home. Breakfast and is complementary. Extra mattresses, car and chauffeur services are available separately for additional costs. I ensure that you feel at home and are provided with the same privacy, care and comfort i would like for myself. This place is 15 minutes drive from the airport. Near food street on Barki road. In proximity of Al-Fatah, Jalal Sons and The Tobacco Shop.The spaceThe space is perfect for back packers, travellers, foreigners, couples, families and stags . Its a calm peaceful and secure environment with Parks,Cinema and many other places to visit near by.Its a Family home with private cozy bedroomswith very comfortable mattresses. We try to make sure aboutour customer privacy & comfort during their stay with us .

reviews.reivew: A very nice and welcoming host and always made sure we’re comfortable.
very good

The first vibes were so amazing.. We arrived very late in the night.. Yet the host, Jalal and his crew received and checked us in in a jiffy and cheerfully too.This was just the start of the stay which turned into a memorable one.Our whole family loved the stay.Jalal was always available when we needed help.His team, especially Mr Mushtaq was very kind and helpful.Will surely stay again.

title: Luxurious 2 Bedroom's With balcony at-Kothi,Manali
about: This place is located at the beautiful valley of Kothi, which is 13 km from main Manali town on Manali to Leh Highway. My place is also famous for its best food & accommodation in the Valley.The spaceThis Place is famous for its food and an amazing location. My place is best suitable for those who wants to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Manali town.

reviews.reivew: Location is Amazing! you can go for a small hiking. the view from the rooms is amazing. The place was clean and everyone was very courteous. It was a very beautiful place located amongst the majestic mountains. The food as well was great.

If you are looking for a place away from the hustle of Manali then this is it. Its a perfect combination of a peaceful getaway along with good food. Special thanks to Suresh for hosting wonderful new year eve. It was a great night spend alongside bonfire and good folks.

The stay was very comfortable and the location was very amazing. It is a perfect place to enjoy the snowfall to its fullest. Services were good. It was clean and cozy as well. Far from main city's hush-hush.

A beautiful property located in the middle of the Himalayas. Equipped with all the basic amenitiesand very friendly staff, this place will provide the perfect get-away trip from the usual life. Very nearby to Gulaba, this place provides a perfect non crowded hilly destination.

title: Wooded Bliss Manali | 2 Bed Rooms | Workation
about: Wooded Bliss has mountains views, free WiFi and free private parking, located 3 mi from The Mall Road.It features a patio, a fully equipped kitchen with a microwave, a fireplace, a seating area, a flat-screen TV, a washing machine. A fridge, an oven and stovetop are also available, as well as a kettle.The villa offers an Asian or vegetarian breakfast.A garden can be found along with apple trees and outdoor sitting.The spaceThe cottage is located on a sprawling expanse of greenery. Surrounded by forest and orchards on two sides, it is completely isolated from the crowds. The lawns are absolutely delightful—abloom with colourful flowers, a lovely gazebo in the shade of a delicate tree with seating where you can sit and have a leisurely brunch. Relax in a hammock on a lazy afternoon, and gaze out into the emerald greenery you are ensconced in, or the mountains that seem to be standing guard in the distance! We organise campfires on request, so you can spend a quiet evening toasting marshmallows and sipping on hot cocoa, while the energetic river gushes past, with not a care in the world! Take a walk by the riverside in the day, and surrender to the serenity. Flagstone pathways lead up to the cottage, which is brightly lit with amber lighting that causes the place to exude an inviting aura! Inside, the living room flaunts a rustic walls and wood-panelled flooring. It is appointed with a cushioned seating and a fireplace to keep you warm during cold nights. The bedroomsare beautifully decorated, with traditional rugs in earthy tones, a comfortable bed, and generous windows that let in the sunlight in the day and the mellow light of the stars in the night! Panels of stone and wood flank the bed, giving a unique design effect to the space. The attached bathrooms are aesthetically designed, with modern sanitary ware, a large wall-mounted mirror.

reviews.reivew: Nice place, good hospitality
Awesome place
One of the best places till date. Anish was an amazing host and cherry in the cake was the place was per friendly
best place to be while you visit manali...value for money, the food here is super delicious...🤩🤩🤩🤩🤩

Incredible stay. Exceeded all expectations. Anish, Vaishal and co were great hosts who ensured that we enjoy our stay to the fullest. The food, amenitiesand local tips were all fabulous. A must if you want to explore Manali while staying at a top notch place which is remote and still easily accessible. P.S- wait till you meet Pluto the Spitz

title: Stay in Mud House Under The Stars - 7
about: Once you have entered the gates of this Homestay you will soon feel you have discovered a new home. With a simple welcoming ceremony your hosts, Chhotaram and Mamata, usher you into their rural Rajasthani world. Throughout your stay you will participate and interact with this remarkable family, watching as they go abouttheir daily lives. These are memories you will never forget.The spaceAirbnb Superhost 9 times in a row.Long or short lets.Metro World Magazine.OutLook Traveller Magazine in top ten 1st best homestays in India 2015, 2016 & 2017.Responsible Tourism Long list & Short List 2018Responsible tourism silver Award 2018Located in one of the indian charming indian village called salawas. Our village is artizen village. The house has 9 rooms spacious and all room are on first floor with access to big courtyard.The kitchen in the house has a small refrigerater where you can store your food and drinks. We are always here to help you for all.Include yourself in the rajasthani cuisine served to you for dinner, lunch and breakfast.

reviews.reivew: This is a wonderful place to stay. It was a great experience to leave the cities behind and the tourist sites and have a chance to live with a local family for a while. The food is delicious and the rooms are probably the smartest mud huts in the world! The village safari was a fascinating tour, learning aboutthe old crafts and traditions as well as seeing beautiful wildlife. We also loved the weaving demonstration. We were made to feel so welcome and we definitely left as friends.

This is an exceptional getaway from a busy touristic spot, yet at a reachable distance to the city of Jodhpur. Chhotaram and Mamata are great hosts, who have lots of stories to tell and good hospitality. The food we received here was all home made and I highly recommend it. You have access to a village atmosphere, and local handicrafts at your doorstep. Overall, it was a great experience for us, and wish we stayed longer to explore more.

Wonderful stay at Chhotaram and Mamata’s place. The hospitality was exceptional with amazing experiences , food, service and value. I highly recommend this stay if you are in Jodhpur. It was away from the main city but such a wonderful village to be in. Loved the village safari and seeing the different trades in this village. I could not support this homestay more.

What an incredible way to experience village life in India. Chhotaram and his family were so welcoming and always enforced that we were a part of his family throughout our stay. His wife is an amazing cook and gave beautiful henna, his brother took us on a wonderful village safari, and Chhotaram ensured we had everything we needed throughout our stay. This homestay was the perfect way to enjoy India away from the busy cities. Highly recommend!!

Chottaram and his wife Mamta are one of the most gracious hosts I have met.We were picked up from Jodhpur Railway station by his brother Om and taken to the home stay which is about40 minutes away from Jodhpur, in a village called Salawas. We were accorded a traditional welcome by Mamta.After that, it was like a home, away from home. They took care of all our needs and made us feel like family. The huts that we stayed in were made in the traditional style with mud and thatched roof. It was really cool inside inspire of the heat outside.Don't expect it to be very spacious as it stays true to the design of the original huts that the locals live in. The bedare comfortable with clean linen. There is a fan and an air-cooler. We never got around to using the air cooler as the fan was sufficient. The tiled bath was clean, with a wash basin, shower, Western commode, Health shower, toilet paper, Soap and towels. Hot water was available at all times. Food was excellent. We got to cook and eat with the family. The food is authentic local cuisine like the locals have. Simple and tasty.Mamta taught us how to make the local bajri ki roti which an Indian bread made of Pearl Millet, which is a staple in the area. Her Ginger tea is really delicious and refreshing.Chottaram took us on a tour to a Bishnoi community village and to a Potter's house, where we got to spin the wheel and make a pot.We went on a drive looking for desert Wildlife. We were lucky to spot some Nilgai (this is the largest Asian antelope), herds of Black Buck, a Vulture, a wild boar and Peacocks. Enroute we stopped by a lake where a huge herd of sheep and a camel were being herded by a shepherd. It was indeed a magnificent sight.If you want to experience the rustic real world of rural Rajasthan, I would recommend this home stay. You would come back feeling richer with the experience and also making some friends.

We wanted to stay with a family and connect with local people so we chose this homestay due to the excellent feedback. It is hard to imagine there is a better homestay than Chotaram and Mamata’s - all the feedback you read here is true! They are warm welcoming hosts with a lovely extended family that lives in this group of traditional huts with them. The food is amazing and included in the pricefor the room! This family leads a cooperative of rug weavers and the sense of community really is all around, it was special to experience this. In the same spirit, Chotaram designed a village tour where he takes you to visit potters, textile embroiderers, a bisnoi family and even spotting wild animals like a safari where he shares the tour fee with the families. We also got to see how the dhurry rugs are weaved on a traditional loom. In general we learned a lot aboutdaily life, Chotaram is happy to spend time with his guests and knows very good English. Overall a perfect stay, we would strongly recommend this to anyone!

title: Heritage Stay near Lake Pichola
about: Our place is a Boutique Heritage  Homestay in the heart of the city carrying history  of 240 years old. It got its unique style of  architecture, Courtyard, Temple and a beautiful Step well. A five beautifully crafted room property with traditional designed furniture and a roof top palace view Patio. Our homestay is on walking distance from Famous  Lake Pichola and Enormous City palace of Udaipur as well as most of the other tourist attraction places.The spaceEnjoy the full furnished Bedroom with bathroom attached in a beautiful Haveli in the quietest location in the heart of the city udaipur. The decoration is very simple. I stay with my lovely family which includes my father, mother, wife and son, This bedroom space is an ideal getaway for anybody visiting Udaipur. It can accommodate from  2 guests up till 3 guests(If you take the extra mattress). There is a comfortable large bed with side lamps. The room has sitting chairs and table,television, luggage rack, enough plug points to charge your electronics and a attached bathroom with hot water. Toiletries are on the house. We do have a kitchen pantry from where we can serve you lovely breakfast in the morning on the beautiful terrace and if required we can make lunch and dinner (on request) subject to availability. But if you wish to eat outside, there is a large variety of eateries near by to feed your hungry stomach.

reviews.reivew: Very nice & safe place to stay, especially for female solo travelers. The hometsay is quite in the main city; walking distance to all major tourist visit/shopping/eating places. Great heritage haveli, ambience, surroundings,  cleanliness and decor. There is a stepwell and an old temple inside the premises. The terrace is nice with City Palce-view. Nagendra was super helpful and hospitable. He made a trip-plan for me too. He allows Swiggy/Zomato delivery. Would love to revisit the place and city again. :)
Superb place feltlike a palace . Very very comfortable clean bedtotally value for money
Very near to Pichola lake and major attractions like city palace....A quite homely place...value for money...
Excellent Host, with good service
Wow! Best place we’ve stayed in India so far. The photos don’t fully show how beautiful this historic space is. A charming and accommodating host who gave us loads of great local recommendations.
My parents had a very comfortable stay at Nagendra's place. He and his wife were very hospitable and courteous.

title: Heritage Mansion by royal architect- Hillview room
about: Heritage Mansion B&B offers a unique experience to stay in a period property with exquisite features. Builtby a royal British architect in 1940 and contains three spacious individual en-suite bedroomswith stunning decor. Enjoy access to the mountain view U-shaped lounge, modern kitchen and a beautifully landscaped massive garden. Situated in a safe and central location, 1 km away from Tourist Centre. A delicious breakfast will set you off to a memorable day in the valley.

reviews.reivew: Good stay in nice location, great host & super value for money.
very nice host and very good rooms

As soon as I saw the listing on Airbnb i was fascinated and couldn't wait to stay in this property. It was a joy dealing with not only Padsha (the owner) but also Mansoorbhai who was an absolute gem. The property is airy, cozy and extremely comfortable. it's a bit of a walk from Dal lake (atleast about30 mins). If you'd like to just sit and enjoy a nice tastefully done up spacious property...then this is the place. I wish I had a few more days here but hopefully will get a chance to  rreturn again.

Information provided aboutthe room is accurate and the location is indeed friendly in terms of both local and outstation sightseeing. Care taker Mansoor is helpful and always available. The mountain view room is huge and good to accomodate 4-5 adults easily. Nearby markets are accessible via local auto's which are available right outside the property. Overall, a great stay.

Information provided aboutthe room is accurate and the location is indeed friendly in terms of both local and outstation sightseeing. Care taker Mansoor is helpful and always available. The mountain view room is huge and good to accomodate 4-5 adults easily. Nearby markets are accessible via local auto's which are available right outside the property. Overall, a great stay.
Overall a good stay.

title: Comfort Room at Fresco Retreat
about: Luxurious accommodation coupled with a cozy yet lavish Winterfell Restaurant can be expected at The Fresco Retreat.Featuring warm, earth tones, all rooms are spacious and come with stylish and air-conditioned rooms which feature large windows that overlook the vast landscape of The Kathmandu Valley. The soundproof rooms are equipped with a flat-screen TV, Free Wi-Fi,  free bottled water and a tea/coffee maker.The daily breakfast offers English Buffet and à la carte options.The spaceIdeally nestled in the expatriate hub of Kathmandu Valley, i.e. Jawalakhel, Fresco Retreat provides the perfect accommodation for travelers who seek to experience the accurate work environment. Fresco Retreat was ideally a family house where we were serving diplomatic guests for the past 15 years. Later we decided to convert the property into a premium bed and breakfast and renovate the property in a way where every traveler could feel the rich culture of Nepal.

reviews.reivew: Very nice air B&b. Clean, updated room, nice bathroom, nice balcony. Near shops and grocery store.
Everything aboutthis place was way better than I had expected! Great host, great communication, very secure. Really looking forward to staying here again!

One of the best places I’ve ever stayed at. The hospitality was incredible. The room was large and spacious with a really comfy bed. I was able to receive top notch acupuncture and a massage at their on-site spa. I woke up everyday feeling so relaxed and comfortable. The included breakfast was delicious and filling. I will 100% be staying here again and any time I visit Nepal in the future. Thanks again :)
Thanks you very much.

This place is a hidden gem in Jawalakhel area and I’m glad I found it. A perfect place to get away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. The staffs were very courteous making sure my stay was comfortable but also giving the space to enjoy ourselves. A home away from home, I would definitely come back to stay here in the future.

Overall had a great experience staying here for two weeks this fall while doing some work and travel around Kathmandu. The room was en suite with bathroom with pedestal toilet and cleaned daily by the staff. A well functioning personal air conditioner, a first for me in Nepal, kept me comfortable in the mornings and coming back from a bike ride. The location is maybe 5-10 min walk from a major road, but it is quite quiet (without any vendors peddling wares in the morning). Additionally there is a restaurant on the premises. Breakfast is included with the room rate. They can make all the Nepali standards quite tasty and get ingredients fresh. They were able to accommodate my raging vegetarianism as well. Can't beat the rate either (I paid ~$300 for 2 weeks).The owner/manager is Aditya and he lives in the building with family as well. He is very helpful and accommodating - he got me a good rate on a mountain bike rental and let me beat him at Fifa one night (there - now it's enshrined in Google for posterity!)

title: Firante Guesthouse - Twin Room with private Bath
about: Some info has been automatically translated.

reviews.reivew: Nice room, nice house, nice family, nice stay :)

Janga's family is very friendly. The room is spacious, clean and sunny. You can also eat authentic Nepali food. The scenery and air on the mountain are also good. If you like quiet, you can choose here!

A very well-equipped home with its own bathroom with impeccably clean hot water (as never seen in Nepal)If you are looking for a quiet place away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu This place is for you The hosts are adorable you can share meals and family life with them

title: StayVista at Luxury Room 1 @ The Kang Estate
about: Discover the true sense of vintage royalty at Kang Estate. It offers a hilly retreat with a massive outdoor deck, a beautiful facade, views that overlook the Deodar forest and much more! Start every morning with a picture perfect view of the valley and the gushing Jana fall which makes for a calming background score. As the sun starts to set and the winds get chilly, gather around the bonfire or fireplace and enjoy a hearty barbecue spread of Himachali cuisine!The spaceThe Kang Estate is special because of its:- Location amidst the forest - Views of valley - Antique decor - Himachali cuisine - Proximity to the Deodar forest - Jana falls in the vicinity We care for your absolute comfort! To that effect, we provide: - Generator, heater, TV - Hangers, iron, torch - Geysers, towels, toiletries- Medical kit, mosquito repellent- Library- Secured, shared parking space for up to 3 carsThe Space:BEDROOMS- There is 1 deluxe bedroom on the ground floor.- An electric and oil heater, a king-sized bed, valley views and an attached bathroom is offered in the room- The room is also equipped with a TV. Please note that there are a total number of 5 bedrooms, and if this listing is booked, guests will have access to 1 room.BATHROOMS- There are 2 bathrooms - 1 attached, 1 powder room. - The attached bathroom has a geyser, towels and basic toiletries.- It is also equipped with a bathtub.COMMON AREAS- The living room is on the ground floor and can seat up to 15 people. - The dining room is a part of the living room and can seat up to 6 people. - There is a 21,780 sq. ft lawn.- It can seat up to 60 people at any given time. KITCHEN- Guests do not have access to the kitchen. - Kitchen is equipped with an oven, a gas stove, a toaster, an induction plate, a mixer-grinder, a refrigerator and a microwave.- Crockery and cutlery are available.FOOD- Breakfast is complimentary- Meals are priced at Rs.800 per meal for a vegetarian and Rs.900 per meal for a non-vegetarian meal, per person, per day.- Guests can also eat out in nearby restaurants like Nagar Delight and Nightingale Cafe.  - Veg barbecue meals can be provided at an additional cost of Rs. 3000 per day, and non-veg barbecue meals can be provided at an additional cost of Rs. 4000 per day. - Guests are required to update if barbeque is required 72 hours prior from check in date. - Consumption of non-vegetarian food is allowed.

reviews.reivew: My husband & I had a spectacular time at the property. This estate house is located admits the forest & apple orchards. The house is tastefully done up, giving attention to details. The care-taker Rajneesh was extremely sweet & warm. He made our stay very comfortable. We thoroughly enjoyed the lip-smacking home food cooked by Thakur from fish curry to mutton curry to biryani. If you are looking for some time off from your hectic schedules, this  is definitely your go-to place. No traffic, no honks, only fresh air & birds chirping! We are definitely going to visit again.

title: Chanod Haveli Royal Heritage Home
about: A 100 year old Heritage Property now opened to guests. The rooms have been renovated to provide a comfortable stayl As you keep visiting again n again you will experience a newness We  started with two rooms but now have four rooms and your presence and stay will b a pleasure for us In spite of being inside the old walled city it is spacious quiet  and comfortable and the rooftop offers a magnificent view of the entire old city and the Mehrangarh FortThe spaceThe Haveli has ample space with verandahs on all floors The rooms have their own extra private verandahs A fantastic rooftop 3000  sq feet from where you can see the whole city n the Umaid Bhawan n the Mehrangarh fort

reviews.reivew: The hosts are true gems and their hospitality is amazing. Uncle and aunty were very friendly and kept in touch with us even after the end of our trip.
Very clean linen specially the bathrooms.beautiful old Haveli, lovely big rooms, warm hospitality,Meenakshi and Shailender have such a warm personal touch.

What do i say! Am beyond words on our experience with Shailendar uncle and Meenakshi Aunty. They received us warmly like their kids coming from city for a weekend. Rooms were utterly clean and well maintained though being a fairly large complex. Food, this is the ultimate here after strolling thru 8 days across Rajasthan had real taste of Dal Batti Churma  here. Breakfast was so amazing that we all had it for whole day that we used to return back in the night to have dinner only at their home. Hospitality, that was north star of the stay they took care to drop us back to station seeing so much of shopping luggage with out even we requesting for it. Resembled visiting grandmother home during my childhood days which leaves us with lovely memories. Overall an excellent pick of our travel.
Excellent Hospitality, amazing Haveli with all the amenities. Breakfast served by aunty makes you feel home. Highly recommended.

Shailendra ji and Meenakshi ji were excellent hosts who took care of us really well.  We had travelled to Jodhpur for a family celebration and the couple were extremely sensitive to our needs. They took care of special diets, addressed accessibility issues  such as climbing stairs, doubled up as guides and gave us excellent tips for shopping and eating out. Shailendra ji even dropped us and picked us up from the Railway station. We had a wonderful stay in Jodhpur and will have very fond memories of Chanod Haveli. Comes highly recommended from us. Thanks once again to the super-hosts !!

title: Royal Heritage Residency
about: Some info has been automatically translated.

reviews.reivew: This is a great place to stay and will transport you to a completely different era.. Yet, the rooms would offer you everything a modern facility would. It’s truly a wonderful Haveli experience with the best of hosts. They were kind enough to allow us to checkin early and also refresh ourselves post checkout! The food is good and the entire property has lovely nooks and corners you can take ample pictures from. Lastly, don’t forget to ask the hosts if their desert camp - Bordi is available and just book a night stay there! It is truly world class and a superb experience! I’m definitely staying here again when I visit Jaisalmer!
It was a very pleasant stay at haveli. Kesari and Sunidhi are great host and was available for our queries all the time. Our stay at haveli was exactly like a home and highly recommended.
Heritage property that too in the center of Jaisalmer. Vibe and the architecture is very beautiful. will surely recommend it
The place gives true insight to the royalty of Jaisalmer with being centrally located, The staff is very cordial and warmth. In all a well deserved experience.

Beautiful and comfortable Haveli. Staff and hosts are very warm and hospitable. We had a great stay. The Haveli is so well situated in the heart of town and a walk away from everything one needs to see.

location is absolutely perfect, Right in front of Jaisalmer fort . very helpful staff and i highly recommend this place . There are multiple listings available, have a look into them and book specific room for making your stay more unique. Please spend some time with host and understand the history of haveli . special shoutout to property manager Chandan for making stay more comfortable.
